names.pinyin: yi shen yang xue tiao chong fang
names.english: tonify the kidneys, nourish the blood and harmonize the chong formula
names.commonEnglish: Tonify the Kidneys, Nourish the Blood and Harmonize the Chong Formula

actions: Tonifies the Kidneys, strengthens Yang and increases the libido.
Warms the Womb and warms and unblocks the Chong and Ren channels.
With Dang Gui, Shu Di Huang and Bai Zhu, for infertility, irregular uterine bleeding and vaginal discharge due to Cold from Deficiency of the Womb and the Sea of Blood.
Tonifies the Kidneys, strengthens Yang, disperses Wind-Cold-Damp and strengthens the sinews and bones.
Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys, strengthens the sinews and bones, stops uterine bleeding, promotes the movement of Blood and alleviates pain.
Tonifies the Kidneys, strengthens Yang,regulates the Chong and Ren channels, stabilizes the Dai Channel and treats Cold Deficient uterine bleeding and vaginal discharge.
Warms the Middle Jiao, disperses Cold, dispels Dampness, relieves diarrhea and alleviates pain.
Nourishes and tonifies Liver and Kidney Blood and Yin and benefits Jing.
With Shu Di HUang, for Liver and Kidney Deficiency.
Tonifies, invigorates and harmonizes the Blood, disperses Cold and regulates the menses.
With Bai Shao, regulates and harmonizes Qi and Blood.
With Chuan Xiong, harmonizes, nourishes and invigorates the Blood and disperses Blood Stasis.
With Bai Shao, Shu Di Huang and Chuan Xiong, for menstrual irregularity, amenorrhea, and dysmenorrhea due to Blood Deficiency or Blood Stasis.
Invigorates the Blood and promotes the movement of Qi.
With Dang Gui, for Blood Deficiency causing menstrual problems including dysmenorrhea, scanty menses and amenorrhea.
Nourishes the Blood, astringes Yin, regulates menstruation, softens the Liver and relieves pain.
With Dang Gui, nourishes Yin and Blood.
With Dang Gui and Shu Di Huang, for dizziness, blurred vision and dysmenorrhea due to Blood Deficiency or Stasis.
Nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin, nourishes Jing and Blood and fills the Marrow.
With Dang Gui, for Blood Deficiency marked by dizziness, palpitations, insomnia and menstrual dysfunction.
Promotes the movement of Qi and alleviates pain.
Tonifies Kidney Yang
Nourishes Blood
Tonifies Qi
Nourishes the Chong and Ren channels
Nourishes the uterus

symptoms: Long term infertility or infertility in an older woman
Possibly a history of late menarche
Delayed menstruation with decreased and pale menses or
Scanty, dark discharge at the end of menstruation
Aches and weakness in the waist and legs
Long-drawn-out urination with a thin stream or dribbling
Pain and coldness in loin and knees
Cold sensation in the lower abdomen
manifestations.pulse: Deep and weak or Thin and soft or Deep and thready or Deep, thready and forceless or Deep and slow

modifications.purpose: fatigue, shortness of breath and a dragging feeling in the lower abdomen
